meanings.definition: To make neat or stylish in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She decided to spiff up her room by organizing her books and toys.
meanings.sent2: He always likes to spiff up before going out on a date.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to spiff up its fur by licking it clean.
meanings.sent4: The sun's rays spiffed up the dull paint on the old house.
meanings.sent5: The magic wand spiffed up the plain pumpkin into a golden carriage.

meanings.sent1: He had a spiff that made everyone turn their heads.
meanings.sent2: She always dressed with a spiff for special occasions.
meanings.sent3: The clown's colorful wig added a spiff to his outfit.
meanings.sent4: The new car had a spiff that made it stand out on the road.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape fluttered behind him, adding a spiff to his costume.

meanings.definition: A bonus or reward given for good work.
meanings.sent1: The employees received a spiff for exceeding their sales targets.
meanings.sent2: She was thrilled to receive a spiff for her excellent performance.
meanings.sent3: The students were surprised with a spiff for their hard work on the project.
meanings.sent4: The team captain awarded a spiff to the player of the match.
meanings.sent5: The chef received a spiff for creating a delicious new dish for the menu.
